results.title: Drone Maker D.J.I. May Be Sending Data to China, U.S. Officials Say
results.abstract: A memo from the Immigration and Customs Enforcement bureau says the firm’s commercial products may be sending sensitive information about U.S. infrastructure back to China, raising security concerns.

multimedia.caption: A drone made by D.J.I. in a demonstration at the company’s headquarters in Shenzhen, China, last year. The company said accusations by the Immigration and Customs Enforcement agency that it shares sensitive information on American infrastructure with the Chinese government were false.

results.title: A.I. Will Transform the Economy. But How Much, and How Soon?
results.abstract: Three new reports suggest that artificial intelligence can probably do less right now than you think. But by one estimation, up to a third of American workers will have to switch jobs by 2030 largely because of it.

multimedia.caption: Artificial intelligence can be used for image recognition, like in this display at a recent technology conference. Researchers are scrambling to understand the potential implications of A.I.

results.title: Justices Seem Ready to Boost Protection of Digital Privacy

results.title: Microsoft to Expand Campus, as Amazon Looks Elsewhere
results.abstract: The software giant plans to invest billions of dollars in renovating its campus in Redmond, Wash., to create a more urban atmosphere.

results.title: Initial Coin Offerings Horrify a Former S.E.C. Regulator

results.title: Amazon, in Hunt for Lower Prices, Recruits Indian Merchants
results.abstract: Thousands of Indian sellers have shipped bedding, jewelry, kitchenware and clothing to Amazon warehouses to serve bargain-hunting Americans.

results.title: Brands Heed Social Media. They’re Advised Not to Forget Word of Mouth.
results.abstract: While online comments can be a valuable tool for gauging public sentiment, a study found that consumers may send different messages when talking with family and friends.

multimedia.caption: Nordstrom’s flagship store in downtown Seattle. President Trump’s tweet earlier this year critical of Nordstrom did not end up hurting the retailer’s sales.

results.title: If No One Owns the Moon, Can Anyone Make Money Up There?
results.abstract: Ambiguities in the 50-year-old Outer Space Treaty may be getting in the way of entrepreneurs seeking opportunities elsewhere in our solar system.

multimedia.caption: The moon has been overlooked since NASA's Apollo missions. Private companies are now looking to set up shop.
The moon has been overlooked since NASA's Apollo missions. Private companies are now looking to set up shop.
The moon has been overlooked since NASA's Apollo missions. Private companies are now looking to set up shop.

results.title: Cities That Never Sleep Are Shaped by Sunrise and Sunset
results.abstract: A study using cellphone call records of more than a million people found that city dwellers continue to be affected by Earth’s natural light-dark cycle.

multimedia.caption: The Promenade des Anglais at sunset in Nice, France. Even in artificially-lit urban areas, people are active longer in the summer and less so in winter, a study of city-dwellers in southern Europe found.
